00030 void myStub_sis3803(void)
00031 {
00032    static int sis3803_private_counter = 0;
00033 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00034    sis3803_int_source_disable(0, 0);
00035    logMsg("sis3803 IRQ#%i served\n", sis3803_private_counter++, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00036    sis3803_int_source_enable(0, 0);
00037 #endif
00038 }

00040 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00041 INLINE DWORD sis3803_module_ID(const DWORD base_adr)
00042 /**************************************************************\
00043  Purpose: return the Module ID number (I) version (V)
00044           IRQ level (L) IRQ vector# (BB)
00045  Input: 
00046   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00047  Output:
00048     none
00049  Function value:
00050  DWORD                : 0xIIIIVLBB
00051 \**************************************************************/
00052 {
00053    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00054 
00055    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + MODULE_ID);
00056    return *spec_adr;
00057 }
00058

00077 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00078 INLINE DWORD sis3803_IRQ_REG_read(const DWORD base_adr)
00079 /**************************************************************\
00080  Purpose: return the lower 12 bits corresponding to
00081           VME IRQ enable, levels, vector(lower 8bits)
00082  Input: 
00083   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00084  Output:
00085     none
00086  Function value:
00087  DWORD                : 0xE(1)L(3)V(8)
00088 \**************************************************************/
00089 {
00090    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00091 
00092    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + IRQ_REG);
00093    return (*spec_adr & 0xFFF);
00094 }
00095 
00096 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00097 INLINE DWORD sis3803_IRQ_REG_write(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD irq)
00098 /**************************************************************\
00099  Purpose: write irq (ELV) to the register and read back 
00100  Input: 
00101   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00102   DWORD irq           : reg 
00103  Output:
00104     none
00105  Function value:
00106  DWORD                : 0xE(1)L(3)V(8)
00107 \**************************************************************/
00108 {
00109    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00110 
00111    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + IRQ_REG);
00112    *spec_adr = irq;
00113    return (*spec_adr & 0xFFF);
00114 }

00116 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00117 INLINE DWORD sis3803_input_mode(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD mode)
00118 /**************************************************************\
00119  Purpose: Set input configuration mode (only mode 1 available)
00120  Input: 
00121   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00122   DWORD mode          : Mode 0-3
00123  Output:
00124     none
00125  Function value:
00126     DWORD             : current mode
00127 \**************************************************************/
00128 {
00129    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00130 
00131    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_WRITE);
00132    if (mode < 4)
00133       mode <<= 2;
00134    *spec_adr = mode;
00135    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_READ);
00136    return ((*spec_adr & GET_MODE) >> 2);
00137 }
00138 
00139 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00140 INLINE DWORD sis3803_ref1(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD endis)
00141 /**************************************************************\
00142  Purpose: Enable/Disable Reference on Channel 1
00143  Input: 
00144   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00145   DWORD endis         : action either ENABLE_REF_CH1
00146                                       DISABLE_REF_CH1
00147  Output:
00148     none
00149  Function value:
00150                : status of the ref1 1=enable, 0=disable
00151 \**************************************************************/
00152 {
00153    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00154 
00155    if ((endis == ENABLE_REF_CH1) || (endis == DISABLE_REF_CH1)) {
00156       spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + endis);
00157       *spec_adr = 0x0;
00158    } else
00159       printf("sis3803_ref1: unknown command %d\n", endis);
00160 
00161    /* read back the status */
00162    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_READ);
00163    return ((*spec_adr & IS_REF1) ? 1 : 0);
00164 }
00165 
00166 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00167 INLINE void sis3803_channel_enable(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD pat)
00168 /**************************************************************\
00169  Purpose: Enable pat channel for acquistion.
00170           blind command! 0x0..0xffff
00171  Input: 
00172   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00173   DWORD pat           : channel pattern
00174  Output:
00175     none
00176  Function value:
00177     none
00178 \**************************************************************/
00179 {
00180    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00181 
00182    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + SELECT_COUNT_DIS_REG);
00183    *spec_adr = (~pat & 0xffff);
00184 }
00185 
00186 
00187 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00188 INLINE void sis3803_channel_disable(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD pat)
00189 /**************************************************************\
00190  Purpose: Disable pat channel for acquistion.
00191           blind command! 0x0..0xffff
00192  Input: 
00193   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00194   DWORD pat           : channel pattern
00195  Output:
00196     none
00197  Function value:
00198     none
00199 \**************************************************************/
00200 {
00201    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00202 
00203    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + SELECT_COUNT_DIS_REG);
00204    *spec_adr = pat & 0xffff;
00205 }

00207 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00208 INLINE DWORD sis3803_CSR_read(const DWORD base_adr, const DWORD what)
00209 /**************************************************************\
00210  Purpose: Read the CSR and return 1/0 based on what.
00211           except for what == CSR_FULL where it returns current CSR
00212  Input: 
00213   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00214   DWORD what          : bitwise field (see sis3803.h)
00215  Output:
00216     none
00217  Function value:
00218  DWORD             : CSR 32bit current content
00219 \**************************************************************/
00220 {
00221    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00222 
00223    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_READ);
00224    if (what == CSR_FULL)
00225       return *spec_adr;
00226    else
00227       return ((*spec_adr & what) ? 1 : 0);
00228 }
00229 
00230 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00231 INLINE DWORD sis3803_CSR_write(const DWORD base_adr, const DWORD what)
00232 /**************************************************************\
00233  Purpose: Write to the CSR and return CSR_FULL.
00234  Input: 
00235   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00236   DWORD what          : bitwise field 
00237  Output:
00238     none
00239  Function value:
00240  DWORD             : CSR 32bit current content
00241 \**************************************************************/
00242 {
00243    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00244 
00245    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_WRITE);
00246    *spec_adr = what;
00247    return sis3803_CSR_read(base_adr, CSR_FULL);
00248 }

00376 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00377 INLINE void sis3803_single_clear(const DWORD base_adr, const INT ch)
00378 /**************************************************************\
00379  Purpose: Clear single scaler channels + overflow bits
00380  Input:
00381   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00382  Output:
00383     none
00384  Function value:
00385  none
00386 \**************************************************************/
00387 {
00388    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00389 
00390    if (ch < 16) {
00391       spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + COUNTER_CLEAR + (ch << 2));
00392       *spec_adr = 0x0;
00393    }
00394 }
00395

00405  none
00406 \**************************************************************/

00409 
00410    if (ch < 16) {
00411       spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + OVERFLOW_CLEAR + (ch << 2));
00412       *spec_adr = 0x0;
00413    }
00414 }

00416 /*********** INLINE function for General command ***********/
00417 INLINE void sis3803_counter_read(const DWORD base_adr, INT ch, DWORD * pvalue)
00418 /**************************************************************\
00419  Purpose: Reads one individual scaler
00420  Input:
00421   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00422   INT   ch            : Channel to be read
00423   DWORD *pvalue       : destination pointer
00424  Output:
00425     none
00426  Function value:
00427     none
00428 \**************************************************************/
00429 {
00430    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00431 
00432    if (ch < 16) {
00433       spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + COUNTER_READ + (ch << 2));
00434       *pvalue = *spec_adr;
00435    }
00436 }
00437 
00438 /*********** INLINE function for General command ***********/
00439 INLINE void sis3803_all_read(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD * pvalue)
00440 /**************************************************************\
00441  Purpose: Reads all 16 channels scaler
00442  Input:
00443   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00444   DWORD *pvalue       : destination pointer
00445  Output:
00446     none
00447  Function value:
00448     none
00449 \**************************************************************/
00450 {
00451    INT i;
00452    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00453 
00454    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + COUNTER_READ);
00455    for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00456       *pvalue++ = *spec_adr++;
00457    }
00458 }
00459

00526 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00527 INLINE void sis3803_OVFL_grp1_read(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD * reg)
00528 /**************************************************************\
00529  Purpose: Read Overflow reg for group 1 (1-8) 
00530  Input:
00531   DWORD base_addr     : base address of the SIS3803
00532  Output:
00533     reg               : pointer to overflow reg 
00534  Function value:
00535  none
00536 \**************************************************************/
00537 {
00538    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00539 
00540    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + OVERFLOW_REG1_8);
00541    *reg = *spec_adr;
00542    *reg >>= 24;
00543 }
00544

00549  Input:

00552     reg               : pointer to overflow reg 
00553  Function value:
00554  none
00555 \**************************************************************/

00557    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00558 
00559    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + OVERFLOW_REG9_16);
00560    *reg = *spec_adr;
00561    *reg >>= 24;
00562 }

00564 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00565 INLINE void sis3803_int_source_enable(const DWORD base_adr, const int intnum)
00566 /**************************************************************\
00567  Purpose: Enable the interrupt for the bitwise input intnum (0xff).
00568           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE
00569  Input:
00570   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the sis3803
00571   DWORD * intnum          : interrupt number (input 0:7)
00572  Output:
00573     none
00574  Function value:
00575     none
00576 \**************************************************************/
00577 {
00578    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00579    DWORD int_source;
00580 
00581    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_WRITE);
00582    switch (intnum) {
00583    case 0:
00584       int_source = ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS0;
00585       break;
00586    case 1:
00587       int_source = ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS1;
00588       break;
00589    case 2:
00590       int_source = ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS2;
00591       break;
00592    default:
00593       logMsg("Unknown interrupt source (%d)\n", int_source, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00594    }
00595    *spec_adr = int_source;
00596 }
00597 
00598 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00599 INLINE void sis3803_int_source_disable(const DWORD base_adr, const int intnum)
00600 /**************************************************************\
00601  Purpose: Disable the interrupt for the bitwise input intnum (0xff).
00602           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00603  Input:
00604   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the sis3803
00605   int     level           : IRQ level (1..7)
00606   int   * intnum          : interrupt number (input 0..3)
00607  Output:
00608     none
00609  Function value:
00610     none
00611 \**************************************************************/
00612 {
00613    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00614    DWORD int_source;
00615 
00616    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_WRITE);
00617    switch (intnum) {
00618    case 0:
00619       int_source = DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS0;
00620       break;
00621    case 1:
00622       int_source = DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS1;
00623       break;
00624    case 2:
00625       int_source = DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS2;
00626       break;
00627    default:
00628       logMsg("Unknown interrupt source (%d)\n", int_source, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00629    }
00630    *spec_adr = int_source;
00631 }
00632 
00633 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00634 INLINE void sis3803_int_source(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD int_source)
00635 /**************************************************************\
00636  Purpose: Enable the one of the 4 interrupt using the
00637           predefined parameters (see sis3803.h)
00638  Input:
00639   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the sis3803
00640   DWORD * intnum          : interrupt number (input 0..3)
00641  Output:
00642     none
00643  Function value:
00644     none
00645 \**************************************************************/
00646 {
00647    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00648 
00649    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_WRITE);
00650 
00651    int_source &= (ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS0 | ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS1
00652                   | ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS2
00653                   | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS0 | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS1 | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS2);
00654    *spec_adr = int_source;
00655 }
00656 
00657 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00658 INLINE void sis3803_int_attach(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD base_vect, int level,
00659                                void (*isr) (void))
00660 /**************************************************************\
00661  Purpose: Book an ISR for a bitwise set of interrupt input (0xff).
00662           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00663  Input:
00664   DWORD * base_addr      : base address of the sis3803
00665   DWORD base_vect        : base vector of the module
00666   int   level            : IRQ level (1..7)
00667   DWORD isr_routine      : interrupt routine pointer
00668  Output:
00669     none
00670  Function value:
00671     none
00672 \**************************************************************/
00673 {
00674    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00675 
00676    /* disable all IRQ sources */
00677 /*  Should be done but not in attach 
00678   sis3803_int_source(base_adr
00679                              , DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS0
00680                              | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS1
00681                              | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS2);
00682 */
00683 
00684 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00685    if ((level < 8) && (level > 0) && (base_vect < 0x100)) {
00686       spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + IRQ_REG);
00687       *spec_adr = (level << 8) | VME_IRQ_ENABLE | base_vect;
00688       sysIntEnable(level);      /* interrupt level */
00689    }
00690    intConnect(INUM_TO_IVEC(base_vect), (VOIDFUNCPTR) isr, 0);
00691 #else
00692    printf("Not implemented for this OS\n");
00693 #endif
00694 }
00695 
00696 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00697 INLINE void sis3803_int_detach(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD base_vect, int level)
00698 /**************************************************************\
00699  Purpose: Unbook an ISR for a bitwise set of interrupt input (0xff).
00700           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00701  Input:
00702   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the sis3803
00703   DWORD base_vect        : base vector of the module
00704   int   level            : IRQ level (1..7)
00705  Output:
00706     none
00707  Function value:
00708     none
00709 \**************************************************************/
00710 {
00711 
00712    /* disable all IRQ sources */
00713 /*  Should be done but not in detach 
00714   sis3803_int_source(base_adr   , DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS0
00715                     | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS1
00716                     | DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS2);
00717 */
00718 
00719 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00720 /* Suppose to save the default isr before attach but would
00721  * required isr table in case of multiple IRQ
00722  * for now restore with myStub()
00723  */
00724    intConnect(INUM_TO_IVEC(base_vect), (VOIDFUNCPTR) myStub_sis3803, 0);
00725    sysIntDisable(level);        /* interrupt level */
00726 #else
00727    printf("vector : 0x%x\n", base_vect + intnum);
00728 #endif
00729 }
00730 
00731 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00732 INLINE void sis3803_int_clear(const DWORD base_adr, const int intnum)
00733 /**************************************************************\
00734  Purpose: Disable the interrupt for the bitwise input intnum (0xff).
00735           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00736  Input:
00737   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the sis3803
00738   int   * intnum          : interrupt number (input 0..3)
00739  Output:
00740     none
00741  Function value:
00742     none
00743 \**************************************************************/
00744 {
00745    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00746    DWORD int_source;
00747 
00748    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr + CSR_WRITE);
00749    switch (intnum) {
00750    case 0:
00751       int_source = DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS0;
00752       *spec_adr = int_source;
00753       int_source = ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS0;
00754       *spec_adr = int_source;
00755       break;
00756    case 1:
00757       int_source = DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS1;
00758       *spec_adr = int_source;
00759       int_source = ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS1;
00760       *spec_adr = int_source;
00761       break;
00762    case 2:
00763       int_source = DISABLE_IRQ_DI_BS2;
00764       *spec_adr = int_source;
00765       int_source = ENABLE_IRQ_EN_BS2;
00766       *spec_adr = int_source;
00767       break;
00768    default:
00769       logMsg("Unknown interrupt source (%d)\n", int_source, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00770    }
00771 }
00772 
00773 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00774 void sis3803_setup(const DWORD base_adr, int mode, int dsp)
00775 {
00776    switch (mode) {
00777    case 1:
00778       /* */
00779       if (dsp) {
00780          printf("Setting          : %d \t", mode);
00781          printf("Info             : PAA/June 2000\n");
00782       }
00783       sis3803_module_reset(base_adr);
00784       sis3803_input_mode(base_adr, 1);  /* mode 1 ONLY */
00785       sis3803_all_enable(base_adr);
00786       sis3803_channel_enable(base_adr, 0xf);    /* 4 channels */
00787       if (dsp)
00788          SIS3803_CSR_read(base_adr);
00789       if (dsp)
00790          printf("# of active ch.  : 4\n");
00791       break;
00792    default:
00793       printf("Undefined mode %d (known mode :1, 2, 3, 4, 5)\n", mode);
00794       break;
00795    }
00796 }
00797

00851 /**************************************************************/
00852 void SIS3803_setup(const DWORD base_adr, int mode)
00853 {
00854    sis3803_setup(base_adr, mode, 1);
00855 }
00856 
00857 void SIS3803_CSR_read(const DWORD base_adr)
00858 {
00859    DWORD csr;
00860 
00861    csr = sis3803_CSR_read(base_adr, CSR_FULL);
00862 
00863    printf("Module Version   : %d\t", ((sis3803_module_ID(base_adr) & 0xf000) >> 12));
00864    printf("Module ID        : %4.4x\n", (sis3803_module_ID(base_adr) >> 16));
00865    printf("LED              : %s \t", (csr & IS_LED) ? "Y" : "N");
00866    printf("Input mode       : %d \n", sis3803_input_mode(base_adr, 1));
00867    printf("Reference pulse 1: %s \t", (csr & IS_REF1) ? "Y" : "N");
00868    printf("Global Enable    : %s \t", (csr & IS_GBL_ENABLE) ? "Y" : "N");
00869    printf("Global OVFL bit  : %s \n", (csr & IS_GBL_OVFL) ? "Y" : "N");
00870    printf("IRQ enable BS0   : %s \t", (csr & IS_IRQ_EN_BS0) ? "Y" : "N");
00871    printf("IRQ enable BS1   : %s \t", (csr & IS_IRQ_EN_BS1) ? "Y" : "N");
00872    printf("IRQ enable BS2   : %s \n", (csr & IS_IRQ_EN_BS2) ? "Y" : "N");
00873    printf("IRQ Bit Source 0 : %s \t", (csr & IS_IRQ_BS0) ? "Y" : "N");
00874    printf("IRQ Bit Source 1 : %s \t", (csr & IS_IRQ_BS1) ? "Y" : "N");
00875    printf("IRQ Bit Source 2 : %s \n", (csr & IS_IRQ_BS2) ? "Y" : "N");
00876    printf("internal VME IRQ : %s \t", (csr & 0x4000000) ? "Y" : "N");
00877    printf("VME IRQ          : %s \n", (csr & 0x8000000) ? "Y" : "N");
00878 }
00879 
00880 void SIS3803_all_read(const DWORD base_adr)
00881 {
00882    DWORD count;
00883    INT i;
00884 
00885    for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00886       sis3803_counter_read(base_adr, i, &count);
00887       printf("Counter[%i] : %u\n", i, count);
00888    }
00889 }
00890 
00891 void SIS3803_all_read_clear(const DWORD base_adr)
00892 {
00893    DWORD count;
00894    INT i;
00895 
00896    for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00897       sis3803_counter_read(base_adr, i, &count);
00898       sis3803_single_clear(base_adr, i);
00899       printf("Counter[%i] : %u\n", i, count);
00900    }
00901 }
00902 
00903 void SIS3803_all_bread(const DWORD base_adr)
00904 {
00905    DWORD count[16];
00906    INT i;
00907 
00908    sis3803_all_read(base_adr, &(count[0]));
00909    for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00910       printf("Counter[%i] : %u 0x%x\n", i, count[i], count[i]);
00911    }
00912 }
00913 
00914 void SIS3803_all_bcread(const DWORD base_adr)
00915 {
00916    DWORD count[16];
00917    INT i;
00918 
00919    sis3803_all_read_clear(base_adr, &(count[0]));
00920    for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00921       printf("Counter[%i] : %u\n", i, count[i]);
00922    }
00923 }

00927 void test(DWORD mem)
00928 {
00929    PART_ID part_id;
00930 
00931    if (p != NULL)
00932       free(p);
00933    (char *) p = malloc(mem);
00934 }
